title: I thought it was Rotis Semi Serif, but...
content:
I thought I had this one nailed, but I was way off. It is contemporary enough where I guessed the resident experts here might know it. Any takers?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905032831im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/body_4064.jpg)

 [‹ Quirky sans serif from Mini publication](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905032831/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44403 "Go to previous forum topic") [Any ideas... ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905032831/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44392 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Tonie Blaze

comments.content: Hmm, hard one. When I first saw it I had a feeling it could be the beautiful [Eidetic Neo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905032831/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_eideticneopro.html) from [PSY/OPS](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905032831/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/PSY%25252FOPS) by Rodrigo Cavazos but that was also wrong even though it has some similarities.
Yes, it is hard. It is “almost” like several fonts that I have found, but just not there. It is a pretty font, though. I would love to own it...but I need to know what it is first!
Hi,before buying it you might have a close look at the “z”. At least on my screen it looks like it is tumbling down.

I think that the “z” is only a screen rendering issue. It seems as if it was scanned a little bit rotated.

Strange that nobody knows this font.

This reminds me of [Tema Cantate](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905032831/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/tema-cantante/) from T-26. If someone tried to make this font more conventional, it would have been more like the sample.

It also reminds me of [Britannia](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905032831/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/atbritannia-bold/) in some ways.

I am finding that the ability to search for ’semiserif’ or ’semisans’ is rather poor at the usual font sites.

The fact we have not found this yet means either that Angel is away from his computer, and/or this is from a pretty obscure source, possibly a freebie font.

- Mike Yanega
